intro: Leucanthemum glabrum, commonly known as the smooth oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its white petals surrounding a yellow central disk, forming a daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are usually hairy as well. Leucanthemum glabrum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
